availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Dozier (Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Dozier. Father of Joseph T. Dozier, Sarah Dozier, Mary J. Dozier, Elizabeth Dozier, William O. Dozier, Richard Dozier, and Reason Dozier. Shoemaker in Knox County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Knox County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from September 22, 1861, to March 1, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barbourville, p. 110.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 212.
Find A Grave, "William A. "Captain Billy" Dozier (1816-1904)," Memorial #15821214, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15821214 (accessed July 29, 2020).
